marketNews.title: Oil, Gold, and CPO Prices Rise Together
marketNews.content:
Prices of several commodities have risen in the past few days. Oil and gold increased during Monday (2/6) night trading while crude palm oil (CPO) rose during Tuesday (3/6) trading. Below is a summary of the price movements of the three commodities:

Oil
Brent futures for the August 2025 contract closed up +2.4% at USD 63.9 per barrel on Monday (2/6) followed by a +1.2% rise to USD 64.7 per barrel on Tuesday (3/6). The price increase responded to two developments: 1) the stable production increase decision by OPEC+ and 2) a decline in the number of rigs in the United States and disrupted supply in Canada.

OPEC+ on Saturday (31/5) decided to maintain the July 2025 production increase of 411,000 barrels per day. This is the third consecutive month that OPEC+ has raised oil production by the same amount, easing market expectations of a more aggressive increase. In addition, the United States reported that the rig count continued to fall throughout May 2025, reaching its lowest level since 2021. Meanwhile, Reuters estimated that 7% of oil production in Canada was affected by forest fires in the province of Alberta.

Brent oil has experienced a -13.5% year-to-date decline as of Tuesday (3/6), driven mainly by the OPEC+ production increase that exceeded initial expectations and weaker demand amid a slowing global economic growth outlook due to trade wars.

Gold
Spot gold rose +3.1% to USD 3,392 per troy ounce on Monday (2/6), reaching a three-week high, before falling -0.9% and closing at USD 3,357 per troy ounce on Tuesday (3/6). The increase occurred alongside growing investor concerns over global uncertainty and a weakening US dollar index (DXY).

The US plan to raise import tariffs on steel and aluminium from 25% to 50%, together with the Ukraine attack on Russia last weekend, heightened investor anxiety. The DXY closed down -0.7% to 98.7 on Monday (2/6).

Gold has risen +28% year-to-date as of Tuesday (3/6) and briefly hit an all-time high of USD 3,500 per troy ounce in April (22/4). The YTD gain is mainly driven by trade tensions that push investors toward safe-haven assets. The DXY has weakened -9.6% year-to-date as of Tuesday (3/6).

CPO
CPO futures for the August 2025 contract rose +2.6% to IDR 3,977 per ton before closing up +1.4% at IDR 3,934 per ton on Tuesday (3/6). The increase followed the Indian governmentâ€™s decision to cut the basic import tariff on crude vegetable oils from 20% to 10% on Friday (30/5).

The policy aims to lower domestic food prices while supporting the local refining industry.

With the adjustment, the total import tariff for crude vegetable oil fell from 27.5% to 16.5%, considering additional levies beyond the basic tariff. The tariff for processed vegetable oil remains unchanged, widening the tariff gap between crude and processed oils and encouraging importers to shift to crude oil imports.

CPO has declined -13.2% year-to-date as of Tuesday (3/6), mainly due to reduced demand from India. Indian CPO imports even fell to a 14-year low in January 2025.

Key Takeaway
The price increases of the three commodities provide positive sentiment for related issuers: 1) oil and gas producers (MEDC, ENRG, RATU); 2) gold producers (ANTM, ARCI, PSAB, BRMS); and 3) CPO producers (TAPG, LSIP, DSNG).

tickerNews.title: TPIA: Chandra Daya Investasi (CDI) Announces IPO Registration
tickerNews.content: $TPIA: The Chief Executive of Market Supervision, Derivatives Finance and Carbon Exchange at the Financial Services Authority, Inarno Djajadi, said that PT Chandra Daya Investasi (CDI), a subsidiary of PT Chandra Asri Pacific, has submitted an IPO registration statement. OJK is reviewing the registration. Kontan received a prospectus showing CDI plans to issue up to 12.48 billion shares (10% of fully paid-up capital) at an offer price of IDR 170-190 per share, potentially raising up to IDR 2.37 trillion.

tickerNews.title: ISAT: Indosat Approves 2024 Dividend and Board Appointment
tickerNews.content: $ISAT: Indosat approved a 2024 dividend of approximately IDR 2.7 trillion or IDR 83.8 per share, representing about 55% dividend payout ratio (vs 48% in 2023) and indicating a 4% dividend yield as of Tuesday (3/6). The cum-date is June 11, 2025, with payment on July 2, 2025. Shareholders also approved the appointment of Syed Bilal Kazmi as director, replacing Ritesh Kumar Singh who resigned on May 26, 2025, and appointed Nezar Patria as the principal commissioner, replacing Halim Alamsyah.

tickerNews.title: BRIS: BUMN Minister Confirms Potential Spin-off and Sukuk Issuance
tickerNews.content: $BRIS: The State-Owned Enterprises Minister, Erick Thohir, confirmed the plan to spin-off Bank Syariah Indonesia, which is still under process and may be transferred under Danantara. Bank Mandiri currently holds the majority stake, followed by Bank Negara Indonesia and Bank Rakyat Indonesia. In June, BRIS plans to issue a second-phase mudharabah sukuk with a principal amount of IDR 5 trillion for new and existing financing. The sukuk consists of Series A (370-day tenor, 6.45% yield), Series B (2-year tenor, 6.55% yield), and Series C (3-year tenor, 6.65% yield). It received an idAAA(sy) rating from Pefindo. The public offering is expected to run from June 19-23, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ADRO: Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend and Management Appointments
tickerNews.content: $ADRO: Shareholders of Alamtri Resources Indonesia approved a 2024 dividend of USD 500 million (approximately IDR 8.2 trillion), implying a final dividend of IDR 159 per share assuming an exchange rate of IDR 16,300 per USD. This corresponds to a dividend payout ratio of about 36% (vs ~49% in 2023) and a final dividend yield of 7.6% as of Tuesday (3/6). The cum-date and payment date have not been announced. Previously, ADRO paid an interim dividend of IDR 106.8 per share in January 2025. Shareholders also approved the appointment of Garibaldi 'Boy' Thohir as Vice President Commissioner and Iwan Dewono Budiyuwono as President Director.

tickerNews.title: UNVR: Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: $UNVR: Shareholders of Unilever Indonesia approved a 2024 dividend of approximately IDR 3.36 trillion, reflecting a dividend payout ratio of about 100% (vs 111% in 2023) and a final dividend of IDR 47 per share. This indicates a final dividend yield of 2.8% as of Tuesday (3/6). The recording date is June 17, 2025; the payment date has not been announced. Previously, UNVR paid an interim dividend of IDR 41 per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: TLKM: Considering Sale of AdMedika for At Least $100 Million
tickerNews.content: $TLKM: Bloomberg reported that Telekomunikasi Indonesia is considering selling AdMedika, a health-care administration company, for at least USD 100 million. TLKM originally acquired a 75% stake in AdMedika in 2010 for IDR 128 billion (approximately USD 7.9 million). AdMedika provides health-claim management services and works with more than 7,800 health facilities in Indonesia and several other countries.

tickerNews.title: MTEL: Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend and Commission Appointment
tickerNews.content: $MTEL: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi approved a 2024 dividend of approximately IDR 2.06 trillion (IDR 25.3 per share), corresponding to a dividend payout ratio of about 98% (vs 75% in 2023) and a dividend yield of 4.2% as of Tuesday (3/6). The cum-date is June 11, 2025, with payment on July 2, 2025. Shareholders also approved the appointment of Fadli Tri Hartono, a special staff of the State Secretary Minister, as the principal commissioner, replacing Yusuf Wibisono. Additionally, Ratu Isyana Bagoes Oka and Faisal Amir Masduki were appointed as commissioners.

tickerNews.title: SPTO: Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: $SPTO: Shareholders of Surya Pertiwi approved a 2024 dividend of IDR 189 billion, corresponding to a dividend payout ratio of 60% (vs 53% in 2023). This implies a final dividend of IDR 35 per share and a final dividend yield of 5% as of Tuesday (3/6). The cum-date and payment date have not been announced. Previously, SPTO paid an interim dividend of IDR 35 per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: SMIL: Procurement of 1,000 Electric Forklifts
tickerNews.content: $SMIL: Sarana Mitra Luas is procuring 1,000 electric forklift units from Heli Southeast Asia Co., Ltd, with an estimated investment of IDR 400-500 billion. The CEO said the company aims to have 75% of its forklift fleet powered by electricity within five years, which should improve margins and support the 2025 revenue target of IDR 420 billion.

tickerNews.title: DAAZ: Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: $DAAZ: Shareholders of Daaz Bara Lestari approved a 2024 dividend of approximately IDR 250 billion, corresponding to a dividend payout ratio of about 55% (vs 54% in 2023). This implies a dividend of IDR 125 per share and a dividend yield of 3% as of Tuesday (3/6). The cum-date is June 11, 2025, with payment on July 3, 2025.
